metadata.title: CVE-2014-6060 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The get_option function in dhcpcd 4.0.0 through 6.x before 6.4.3 allowsremote DHCP servers to cause a denial of service by resetting theDHO_OPTIONSOVERLOADED option in the (1) bootfile or (2) servername section,which triggers the option to be processed again.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dhcpcd5 - 6.0.5-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dhcpcd5 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.5-2').
